newsitem.title: HONG KONG: UPS wins Thai traffic rights.
newsitem.headline: UPS wins Thai traffic rights.

text.p: United Parcel Service of America Inc (UPS) won the right to operate five flights a week from Bangkok, UPS engineering director for Asia, Mark Sobolewski told Reuters.
The start-up date for the flights and the exact routings to and from Thailand have not yet been finalised, he said in an interview.
Sobolweski added the new flights will enhance the company's growing Asian network, and will position it to service the Indo-China region as well as connecting to India and Europe.
UPS has also started construction of a new US$4 million Asia-Pacific hub in Taipei, due to open in March 1997.

The U.S. global package distribution company, which began its Asian operations in 1988, said it recorded an annual average volume growth rate in the Asia-Pacific region of 30-35 percent in recent years.
-- By Jim Gilchrist, Air Cargo Newsroom Tel +44 171 542 8982 Fax +44 171 542 5017
